availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah A. Boswell Smith in Harrison County, Kentucky, on November 4, 1844. Father to Sarah Smith, Julia E. Smith McClune, William B. Smith, Annie M. Smith, Merritt W. Smith, and Joseph G. Smith. Farmer in Fayette County in 1850. Employed William Whitamore as a farmer in Fayette County in 1850. Owned twenty-one enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1850. Farmer in Fayette County in 1860. Owned sixteen enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 1, p. 406B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 36 B-37A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Harrison County Marriages, Film #000216896.
"Granville Smith (1807-1874)," Find A Grave, Memorial #61365384, accessed June 27, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/61365384.
